snippet: A Web site promoting the card suggests its use might represent a “protest with every purchase,” but some in the Occupy movement are displeased with the idea.
abstract: Occupy Money Cooperative, group that includes Cornell law professor and former director of Deutsche Bank, has created prepaid Occupy debit card, aiming to make Occupy a recognized financial services brand; Web site promoting the card, suggesting its use might represent a 'protest with every purchase,' has prompted questions about who controls the name and the message of the Occupy movement.
lead_paragraph: A Web site promoting the card suggests its use might represent a “protest with every purchase,” but some in the Occupy movement are displeased with the idea.

headline.main: Coming Soon? An Occupy Wall Street Debit Card
headline.print_headline: For Wall St. Protesters, New Debit Card Is a Financial Venture of Their Own
